description:
Google Cloud teams work with schools, companies, and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative. You will oversee all aspects of the Google Cloud sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google Cloud program overall is kept on the cutting edge.

As a Learning Designer for Google Cloud, you'll work closely with Program Managers and Subject Matter Experts to design and produce learning experiences for Google Cloud teams. You’ll also be a Consultant to others across the organization, helping them identify the root problem and the best options for learning solutions.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Learning Design, Education, a related field or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of experience designing and developing learning solutions for a variety of formats and audiences (e.g., instructor-led training, e-learning, micro-learning).
  • Experience with Evolve, Camtasia, Articulate Storyline, or similar e-learning development tools.
  • Experience in developing localization-friendly and accessible learning solutions.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with Cloud technologies such as Google Cloud Platform and G Suite.
  • Understanding about how Cloud technology can solve customer business challenges.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate complex concepts concisely and clearly. Effective consulting and relationship management skills.
  • Effective graphic design skills.
  • Exceptional consulting and relationship management skills, with a track record of delivery and impact.
responsibilities:
• Analyze business needs to determine whether there is a learning need and define performance objectives. Collaborate with Program Managers and Subject Matter Experts in a variety of fields to help translate their knowledge into an effective learning experience for others.
  • Develop a range of learning experiences, including instructor-led training (ILT) design, interactive e-learning modules, videos, device learning labs, job aides, facilitator guides, and resource materials.
  • Develop valid training evaluation tools that evaluate behavioral and business impact. Build relationships with stakeholders to set and manage expectations, create project plans, and regularly communicate project update and status.
  • Act as lead curriculum developer on smaller projects with clear outcomes and collaborate with other learning designers on larger or more ambiguous projects.
  • Ensure and drive best practices standardization across all projects, content, and sites.
title: Sales Learning Designer, Google Cloud
